elements.text: PART ONE
TITLES
1. TARDIS CONTROL ROOM
(FX: TARDIS IN FLIGHT. DOCTOR COMPLETES A SEQUENCE OF CONSOLE CONTROLS. )
We'll be arriving on Maxis Realtor shortly, Nyssa. One month after leaving Valderon, as requested. How are you feeling?
Nervous. Excited... Mainly nervous.
You’11 soon be with your daughter.
Neeka’s not seen me for twenty-five years. How will she react?
She’1ll be delighted to see her mother again. Of course she will.
I hope so.
(FX: SUDDEN SURGE OF POWER FROM THE CONSOLE. INSTRUMENTS COME TO LIFE, CHATTERING WITH COMPUTATIONS. THE ROOM TILTS AND STRAINS FROM A SUDDEN COURSE CHANGE. )
CRY OUT AS THEY’RE THROWN ACROSS THE ROOM.
(FX: ROOM LEVELS OUT; POWER SURGE PLATEAUS. INSTRUMENTS CONTINUE TO WORK COMPUTATIONS. )
What was that?!
Course change. Sudden and violent.
Caused by what?
FX: DOCTOR AND NYSSA CROSS TO THE CONSOLE.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 3
The console instruments are making course calculations. The
is doing this!
How is that — [possible]?
(FX: A NEW, DISRUPTIVE FORCE ACTS ON THE TARDIS — THE SHIMMERING, DISTORTING EFFECT OF CVE PASSAGE AS IN ‘FULL CIRCLE’ PART ONE. CONTINUING BEHIND: )
(DISTORTED BY FORCE) (CONTINUED) Doctor, what is this... ?
(DISTORTED) I think I know... But it can’t be.
(DISTORTED) I can’t gather my thoughts, I can’t focus.
(DISTORTED) It will pass, Nyssa.
(FX: DISRUPTION CONTINUES FOR A SHORT PERIOD, THEN EASES,
AWAY... )
(RELIEVED) Told you.
(FX: THEN: BANG! ELECTRICAL EXPLOSIONS, FOLLOWED BY DRAWL OF
SOURCES DRAINING RAPIDLY. )
We’re losing power!
FX: DOCTOR RUNS TO THE CONSOLE, OPERATES CONTROLS.
Emergency landing! Hang on!!
(FX: TARDIS ENGINES GROAN AND STUTTER — LABOURED VERSION OF THE NORMAL LANDING SEQUENCE. LANDING IS ACCOMPLISHED ON LOWER
RESERVES THAN NORMAL, SO IS COMPLETED WITH A THUMP OF IMPACT. )
CRY OUT AT JARRING IMPACT OF THE LANDING.
FX: LANDING SEQUENCE COMPLETES ABRUPTLY.
(SHAKEN) Are you alright?
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 4
(ALSO SHAKEN) I’m in one piece.
FX: TEGAN AND TURLOUGH RUN IN.
(ENTERING) What was that?!
(ENTERING) Did we hit something?
We’ve landed.
On Maxis Realtor?
Oh, I'd say that’s highly unlikely.
Then where?
Shall I check the co-ordinates?
That wouldn’t do much good. Not here.
Why? Where’s ‘here’?
Someone try the scanner, at least!
Good idea.
FX: SCANNER OPENS.
There. That’s what’s outside.
A mountain range. Doesn’t tell us much.
Those are the Meridian Mountains. They separate the Arcadian desert from the lowlands of Outer Gallifrey.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 5
We’re on your home planet?
No. We’re not.
FX: DOCTOR OPENS DOORS.
(CONTINUED) Come outside.
FX: DOCTOR EXITS, THE OTHERS FOLLOW.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL)
2. FOREST CLEARING
Page 6
(FX: GRASS AND UNDERGROWTH AROUND US. A WATERFALL NEARBY, FEEDING A STREAM THAT FLOWS CLOSE TO US. TARDIS DOOR OPENS;
THE FOUR OCCUPANTS STEP OUT. )
A forest?
This isn’t the same place as on the scanner.
Is this another part of Gallifrey?
We’re not on Gallifrey.
Then where are we?
We’re on Alzarius.
Alzarius? But that was Adric’s home world, wasn’t it? was in .. (HESITATES)
. in another universe.
E-Space.
You’re saying we’ve passed into another universe?
And that
This makes no sense. Passing through a CVE is unlikely enough,
but to land on Alzarius again...
A CV-what?
A Charged Vacuum Emboitement.
That’s a thing?
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 7
Not so much a thing as an event. Rare to the point of being improbable.
CVEs were manufactured by the Logopolitans, to protect against universal entropy.
Exactly. The question is, why has the TARDIS brought us here?
The question is, how do we get back?!
I wonder... (TURNS AND EXITS INTO TARDIS. CONTINUES INTO: )
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 8
3. TARDIS CONSOLE ROOM [CONTINUOUS]
FX: DOCTOR, NYSSA, TEGAN AND TURLOUGH RETURN INSIDE
(WALKING IN) I still have Adric’s Alzarian image translator somewhere. I’1ll have to dig it out in due course. (FX:
CONTROLS) We’ll need it to get a true image on the scanner.
(FX: ELECTRONIC SIGNATURE ACCOMPANIES A READ-OUT FROM THE
CONSOLE. )
(SURPRISE) Well, now.
What’s that mean?
A programme has been entered into the TARDIS’s navigational sub-routines.
Yes. It activated itself when it recognised that we were close to a CVE.
Someone programmed the TARDIS to do this?
Who?
Adric.
Adric??
His log-in signature is on the programming.
I don’t get it.
Don’t you remember? Adric calculated a way back to E-Space, when... when he wanted to go back home.
Just before we met the Cybermen! Just before he... (STOPS
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 9
Before he died.
Yes, thank you, Turlough. I didn’t know he’d used the TARDIS instruments.
He must have used a Block Transfer Computation.

He would have known how — the Master showed him, on Castrovalva. That computation would have physically permeated the TARDIS innards and stuck, sitting in the navigation codes, waiting until we passed close to a CVE.
But Adric wanted to return to Terradon, not Alzarius.
He needed a point of reference, for navigation. Alzarius would have been the only point in E-Space that he could mathematically locate.
Can’t we use the same program to go back?
It was a one-way calculation.
And is the TARDIS up to it anyway? That was one bumpy landing.
Yes. That was odd. We suffered a temporary drop in power. There’s still a slight trickle of power loss...
Is it serious?
I should check if the instruments have been damaged...
(FX: DOCTOR CROUCHES DOWN AND OPENS A HATCH UNDER THE CONSOLE.
COMPONENTS INSIDE AS HE EXAMINES THEM. )
(CONTINUED) The comparator looks fine, fully charged, undamaged... Gravitic anomaliser, also good... Now let’s have a look at you.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 10
(FX: HE DISCONNECTS A COMPONENT AND STANDS UP TO EXAMINE IT. IT EMITS A SUBTLE TONE AS HE TURNS IT IN HIS HAND. )
Is that a gem? It looks like a large ruby.
Ever see a ruby with a glowing light inside it?
It looks valuable.

In practical terms, it’s priceless. This is the interface stabiliser. It protects us from severe external forces. Shock, pressure, extreme heat or cold, radiation... It’s crystalline, so holding it up to the light would show any flaws. But... no.
Doctor, are we staying here?
FX: DOCTOR PLACES INTERFACE STABILISER DOWN ON THE CONSOLE.
Until I’ve performed a full diagnostic, at least. Why?
Adric often talked about how the ecology of Alzarius changed every fifty years or so.
Mistfall. He told you about that?
Enough that I think we need to be sure it isn’t going to happen any time soon.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 11
4. MARSHLANDS
(FX: A LARGE, POWERFUL TRANSPORTER VEHICLE COMES TOWARDS US
MUDDY TERRAIN AND HALTS. ENGINE POWERS DOWN. DOORS OPEN AND A LARGE GROUP DISEMBARKS. PIK SOLUS, CLOSEST TO US, OPENS THE DRIVER DOOR AND STEPS DOWN. )
(STEPPING DOWN) Alright, you lot, no time to stand around admiring the view. We’ve a job to do. Get the equipment unloaded.
(NEARBY, LIFTING EQUIPMENT) Yes, Mr Solus.
(FX: ACTIVITY. ITEMS OF KIT — TROLLEYS, AIR CYLINDERS,
CASES — ARE UNLOADED FROM THE VEHICLE. )
And Arana?
Sir?
I want you and your diving team suited up and ready to go in thirty minutes.
We’1ll be ready.
(ALOUD TO THE GROUP) Thirty minutes, people! Then I want our divers in the water. I want them in the marsh!
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 12
5. FOREST CLEARING
FX: DOCTOR, NYSSA, TEGAN AND TURLOUGH EMERGE FROM TARDIS.
(EMERGING) To find out how close we are to Mistfall, we need to find out where Alzarius is in its solar cycle. We’1ll split into two pairs and take star readings using these.
What are they?
Electronic astrolabes. They work in day or night, you just need an unobstructed view of the sky.
I know how to use one of those.
FX: DOCTOR HANDS AN ASTROLABE TO TURLOUGH.
Excellent, here you are. You and Nyssa make for that range of hills over there, Tegan and I will go in the opposite
direction. Meet back at the TARDIS in two hours.
Two hours. See you then.
FX: NYSSA AND TURLOUGH WALK OFF INTO THE FOREST.
Come on, then, Doctor. Best foot forward.
FX: DOCTOR AND TEGAN WALK OFF ALONG A GRASS PATH.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 13
6. MARSHLANDS
(FX: FOUR DIVERS ARE GETTING INTO THEIR DIVING SUITS. SUITS FASTENED, TANKS STRAPPED TO THEIR BACKS.)
You know what you’ve got to do, so let’s get it done. Helmets on, check your breathing.
(FX: DIVERS LATCH ON THEIR HELMETS AND SECURE THEM. THEY OPEN THEIR AIR TUBES; RUSH OF OXYGEN THROUGH BREATHING APPARATUS. )
(DIVING HELMET FILTER) Breathing’s fine, Mr Solus.
Good. Alright, all of you, into the water.
(FX: DIVERS WALK A SHORT DISTANCE AND ENTER THE WATER, WADING IN. )
(CONTINUED) (VOICE RAISED TO ENSURE THEY HEAR HIM) You’ve been in these marsh waters before, but it’s dark under there. Keep close to one another.
(FX: DIVERS CONTINUE FURTHER INTO THE WATER, SUBMERGING THEMSELVES. )
(CONTINUED) Weapons team, stand ready. Just in case.
(FX: TWO CITIZENS RACK THEIR ENERGY WEAPONS, WHICH POWER UP, READY TO FIRE.)
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 14
7. FOREST TRACK
FX: NYSSA AND TURLOUGH WALKING ALONG A DIRT TRACK.
Marshmen?
Violent creatures, Adric said. They hibernate in the water of the marshes, and emerge during Mistfall. There are other fauna as well. Giant spiders. Poisonous apparently.
And it looks so picturesque for now. So much colour. When it wakes up, not so — [pretty.]
(FX: ENERGY WEAPON FIRES IN THE MIDDLE DISTANCE. TURLOUGH IS HIT AND GOES DOWN HEAVILY. )
CRIES OUT AND FALLS
Turlough!
(IN PAIN) My leg! (WINCES) Gah, it feels... I can’t move it!
Can you stand? If I support you?
(TRIES TO STAND, FALLS BACK) No! My leg’s totally numb.
(FX: PUSHING ASIDE FOLIAGE, A CITIZEN GUARD WALKS TOWARDS US FROM THE NEAR DISTANCE, HEFTING A WEAPON. HE RACKS IT,
UP THE NEXT ROUND READY TO FIRE.)
(APPROACHING) Both of you, stay completely still. You, try to run and you’1ll get what he got.
Why did you shoot at us? Who are you?
That’s right. Play the innocent. But you’re not going to be causing us any more trouble. Put your hands — [up] [REACTS IN PAIN, FALLS]
FX: THE CITIZEN GUARD HITS THE GROUND HEAVILY.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 15
What happened to him?
FX: NYSSA CROSSES TO THE BODY, CROUCHES TO EXAMINE HIM.
I don’t know. He put his hand to his neck... There’s a red mark.
(CLOSE BY) He is sleeping.
REACT, SURPRISED
The sap of the night vine does this.
FX: A SECOND FIGURE STEPS OUT FROM THE UNDERGROWTH.
(APPROACHING) What my friend is trying to say is that he hit him with a sleeping dart, a strong soporific. He’ll be unconscious for hours.
Is that... a catapult?
I do not know this word. (BEAT) You are staring.
Sorry. Lt’s Just.
Don’t be alarmed by Drell’s appearance. He is an Haragi. [PRON. HAR-AGGY] The tattoos that cover his body are an adornment of his people. They tell the story of his bloodline.
Who are you?
My name is Yan Fara, and I’m a New Alzarian.
A ‘new’ Alzarian?
Let’s continue this conversation somewhere safer, shall we, um... ?
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 16
Turlough.
And I’m Nyssa.
I still can’t feel my leg...
The feeling will return, Turlough. You were hit with a stun round. Here, let me help you.
FX: FARA LIFTS TURLOUGH AND SUPPORTS HIM
(TAKING TURLOUGH’S OTHER ARM) I’1l1 help.
(WINCING WITH PAIN) Why did he shoot at us?
He thought you were with us.
Eh?
Questions later. Let’s get out of here.
I will make sure this guard is unharmed.
Okay, catch us up.
(FX: FARA, NYSSA AND TURLOUGH HEAD OFF INTO THE TREES. DRELL
BY THE CITIZEN GUARD, TURNS HIM OVER. )
MOANS AS HE IS TURNED, NOT WAKING
You sleep, yes. And now at my hand you will sleep forever.
FX: DRAWS A BLADE FROM ITS SCABBARD, PLUNGES IT INTO GUARD.
A SHORT CRY, THEN HE DIES
Die. As your kind will all soon die.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 17
8. RIVERSIDE
(FX: DOCTOR AND TEGAN ARE WALKING ALONG A GRASS PATH NEXT TO A RIVER. )
Not much further. The forest should open up shortly... Oh.
FX: THEY STOP.
It’s not all a garden paradise, then.
That’s odd. The other side of the river, it’s like nothing is growing.
Dead trees as far as the eye can see. Right up to the hills.
I didn’t see this before. But then again, we didn’t explore far.
Here’s something that might interest you even more. Look. Tyre tracks.
FX: DOCTOR CROUCHES TO EXAMINE THE TRACKS.
Made recently too.
So we’re not alone here?
It would seem not.
FX: HE STANDS AND WALKS AWAY. TEGAN FOLLOWS.
(CONTINUED) (MOVING AWAY) Let’s see where they lead.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 18
9. MARSHLANDS
FX: ARANA BREAKS THE SURFACE AND WADES OUT OF THE WATER.
How’s it going down there?
(FX: ARANA UNFASTENS AND REMOVES HER HELMET. THERE IS A HISS OF OXYGEN AS THE SEAL IS BROKEN. )
All done. The others are just about ready to come up.
Good! Right you lot, I want -
(FROM DISTANCE) You there! You!
Who the devil... ?
(FX: THE DOCTOR APPROACHES AT A PACE ACROSS DIRT AND MUD, TEGAN IN TOW. )
(MIDDLE DISTANCE, APPROACHING) Doctor, do you think we should go rushing in like this?
(APPROACHING) Just what do you think you’re doing?
Weapons ready!
FX: 2 x CITIZEN GUARDS BRING STUN WEAPONS UP TO THE AIM.
(CONTINUED) That’s close enough!
FX: DOCTOR AND TEGAN COME TO A HALT, NOW CLOSE.
Please, I’m the Doctor, this is Tegan.
(NERVOUS) Hi...
We mean you no harm, but you need to get your people out of the water...
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 19
It’s dangerous!
Oh, really?
There are creatures in that marsh. Dormant, but if you disturb them...
Creatures. You mean the Marshmen.
(SURPRISED) You know about the Marshmen?
They’re why we’re here.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 20
10. FOREST TRACK
(FX: FARA AND NYSSA HELPING TURLOUGH ALONG THE TRACK. SLOW PROGRESS. )
WINCING WITH THE EFFORT OF WALKING WHILE SUPPORTED
Not far now.
You said you came here by accident?
A kind of crash landing.
A very unfortunate accident to land on Alzarius.
FX: DRELL COMES RUNNING FROM BEHIND THEM AND JOINS THEM.
(CONTINUED) Drell. Was he alright?
He will sleep for a long time.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 21
11. MARSHLANDS
Why are you here? Tell me.
(FX: TWO DIVERS BREAK THE SURFACE OF THE WATER AND COME ASHORE. )
We'll continue this conversation in a moment. (TO EVERYONE) They’re coming up! I want this to run as smooth as clockwork. Get ready!
Whatever you’re doing — don’t.
Keep those two at gunpoint. Stun them if they get in the way!
(FX: A PEAK IN ACTIVITY. SEVERAL CITIZENS RUNNING TO THEIR POSITIONS. THE REMAINING THREE DIVERS EMERGE FROM THE WATER. )
(CONTINUED) (TO EVERYONE) Okay, here they come!
(FX: THE EMERGING DIVERS, MOVING TOWARDS LAND, ARE SLOWED BY
OBJECTS THEY ARE CARRYING BETWEEN THEM. )
Doctor, what are those things they’re carrying?
This is bad. Very bad.
(FX: THE DIVERS CONTINUE ONTO DRY LAND AND TOWARDS THE TRANSPORTER. )
But what are they? They’re like... giant wet beanbags.
The material is a collagen membrane. Those pods contain living beings — dormant Marshmen.
I think I can make out the shape of... something... inside there. All curled up.
Well done, everyone. Okay, quick as you like, get them into the back of the transporter, into the container.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 22
(FX: DIVERS AND CITIZENS CARRY THE PODS UP A RAMP AND INTO THE REAR OF THE VEHICLE. THEY ARE PLACED IN A WATER TANK. )
(CONTINUED) Gently... Gently!
When they wake up, they’re going to be very angry.
They won’t wake up until we want them to. (CALLS TO HIS TEAM) Okay, lock it up! We need to get them back to base as quickly as we can.
FX: A SHUTTER SLIDES DOWN AND LOCKS, THE RAMP RETRACTS.
What are you going to do with them?
More questions. You know, I could have you two arrested. This planet is out of bounds by Decider Decree seven-eight-six. Tell me what you’re doing here.
Did you just say ‘Decider’... ?
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 23
12. FARA’S CAMP
(FX: NYSSA, TURLOUGH, FARA AND DRELL COME OUT OF A PATCH OF
INTO A CLEARING. A DIRT PATH UNDERFOOT. )
CONTINUES TO WINCE AS HE WALKS
(APPROACHING) It’s over here. We use this greenery as camouflage...
(FX: HE PULLS ON A SWATHE OF VEGETATION THAT FALLS AWAY FROM THE SIDE OF HIS SPACECRAFT. )
A spacecraft?
Just a planet hopper. A birthday present from my parents. Not much to it, but being small makes it easier to hide.
FX: HE ACTIVATES A CONTROL, AND A HATCHWAY SLIDES OPEN.
(CONTINUED) In you go.
Thank you.
FX: THEY ENTER THE SHIP.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 24
13. FARA’S SHIP. (CONTINUOUS)
(FX: A COMPACT INTERIOR ACOUSTIC. ONE OR TWO INSTRUMENTS
OVER. NYSSA, WITH FARA AND DRELL HELPING TURLOUGH, ENTER FROM THE FOREST. )
(ENTERING) Turlough, you can rest on the bench.
(EFFORT OF LYING DOWN) Thanks... I think I’m starting to feel my toes, at least.
You’1l be fully recovered soon.
(ENTERING) You’re right, Fara, there’s not much room.
Drell doesn’t like it, do you, Drell? He likes flying in it even less.
Machines are not good. Not necessary.
The Haragi distrust technology. And I sympathise, I choose
nature over technology whenever I can, but when you have to get from one planet to another there’s no choice. And we’re here to help nature, after all. The nature of Alzarius.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 25
14. MARSHLANDS
FX: THE CITIZENS ARE CLIMBING ABOARD THE TRANSPORTER.
If you came here by accident, as you say, how do you know so much about Alzarius?
It’s a long story — Solus, did I catch that right?
Solus — you mentioned a Decider decree. Are you from the Starliner?
The Starliner?
(TO DOCTOR) Yeah, what’s the Starliner?
(TO SOLUS) The Terradon Starliner. Your people were led by three Deciders.
We still are. But the Starliner was a long time ago.
How long?
I don’t know what to make of you two. For trespassers you’re not well informed.
The Doctor asked you a question. How long?
Get on board, up front with me. We can have the history lesson on the way.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 26
15. FARA’S SHIP
My people are descended from a community that lived ina Starliner that crashed on Alzarius thousands of years ago.
I know something about that.
You do? Then you know that the Starliner left Alzarius three hundred years ago?
Don’t look at me. I know nothing.
Three hundred years? I... Yes. Of course.
The Starliner travelled for a long time after leaving, looking for somewhere suitable for a new home. Then they found a world. The Haragi’s world.
You came from the sky. The first outsiders my ancestors had seen.

We made great friends of the Haragi. We established ourselves, we built and cultivated. We expanded and populated large areas over time. (BITTER) And of course we introduced technology on a grand scale, to a world that had known none of it.
Not our world any more.

The Haragi were - are — a simple people, close to nature. We made it our world, we trampled over the natural beauty of that planet, and came to dominate it. Not through force, but through an absolute and arrogant assumption of our superiority through technology.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 27
16. SOLUS’S TRANSPORTER
FX: IN THE CABIN OF THE VEHICLE AS IT MOVES ALONG.
And this world became your new home?
Those citizens, led by First Decider Login...
(A HAPPY MEMORY) Login! Such a good man...

He saved us. Those first citizens, they worked hard. They built homes that over generations became vast settlements. They built industries that enriched our society. Within a hundred years we were trading with other worlds.
Does your world have a name?
The Haragi had no name for it. So by Decider Decree it was named New Alzarius. (SEEING SOMETHING AHEAD) Oh for goodness’ sake!
FX: SOLUS BRAKES AND HALTS THE VEHICLE.
What is it?
There was a temporary bridge over this ravine.
Where’s it gone?
They must have cut the supporting cables.
Who?
Outlers. We’ll have to find another way round.
FX: SOLUS ENGAGES DRIVE, AND THE VEHICLE TURNS AND MOVES ON.
Outlers. That’s another term from the past.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 28
17. FARA’S SHIP
They call us Outlers — it’s an old term, a pejorative for anyone who doesn’t conform, for anyone who chooses to live free of the whim of the Deciders.
Deciders?
Our leaders. There are three of them, a hangover from the time of the Starliner. Appointed at the discretion of the First Decider. We don’t do democracy.
How many of you ‘Outlers’ are there?
Here on Alzarius it’s just me and Drell, but we’re making life difficult for the expedition. Little things. We block the roads, steal their equipment, their food rations, that sort of thing.
Why?
It frustrates them. Makes it difficult for them to move, to do their work.
But why do it at all?
We want them to leave.
We’re not going to let them trample over the beauty of this world as they have done on new Alzarius.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 29
18. SOLUS’S TRANSPORTER
FX: THE VEHICLE MAKING GOOD SPEED.
There you have it. Dead ahead. Alzarius base.
Is that a spaceship?
The central structure is the ship that brought us here. With living modules connected to the hull by sealed walkways.
And your Decider is here?
Decider Merrion. The base is her command post.
This expedition must be very important to your people if you have a Decider to lead it.
It’s our most vital endeavour. But enough, we’re arriving. And we have to get these Marshmen back into water as quickly as we can.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 30
19. ALZARIUS BASE: MERRION’S QUARTERS
(FX: MODESTLY SIZED LIVING SPACE. DECIDER MERRION IS WORKING AT DESK, FINGERS BUSY ON A COMPUTER KEYBOARD. A COMMUNICATOR TRILLS, AND MERRION PRESSES A SWITCH TO TAKE THE CALL. )
Yes?
(COMMUNICATOR FILTER) Decider Merrion? Ma’am, Mr Solus’s compliments. He has returned.
Was he successful?
(COMMUNICATOR FILTER) He’s taking the Marsh creatures to the Science Unit.
Get them into the observation tank. Tell Mr Solus I’1l be there momentarily.
(COMMUNICATOR FILTER) Yes, Decider.
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 31
20. ALZARIUS BASE: TANK ROOM
(FX: A HIGH CEILINGED, METAL WALLED ROOM. OXYGENATED WATER
WITHIN A LARGE GLASS FRONTED TANK. A CRANE ARM IS AT WORK, LOWERING THE PODS INTO THE WATER. )
Steady, I want those pods undamaged... Alright, they’re fully immersed. You can release them.
(FX: THE CRANE STOPS. THE LINE ATTACHING IT TO THE PODS IS
DETACHED AND SPLASHES INTO THE WATER. THE CRANE THEN WITHDRAWS. )
(CONTINUED) Now seal the tank.
FX: A HATCH SLIDES INTO PLACE.
(CONTINUED) Done. Safe and sound. Arana, what’s the water temperature?
FX: ARANA PUNCHES A COUPLE OF BUTTONS ON A WALL MONITOR.
Twenty four degrees.
Perfect.
What you’re doing here is very dangerous.
Not to mention immoral.
If I need your opinions I’1l ask for them.
(FX: BEHIND THE ABOVE, THE MAIN DOOR SLIDES OPEN AND DECIDER
ENTERS. )
(ENTERING) That’s enough, Mr Solus.
My apologies, Decider.
Decider Merrion?
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 32
First Decider Lana Merrion. Who are you?
I’m Tegan. This is the Doctor. You’re in charge of this lot, are you?
(RECOGNISING THE NAME) The Doctor?
They say they came here by accident.
In a blue box perhaps?
You know about the TARDIS?
Tegan...
Solus, these are friends of New Alzarius and are to be afforded every hospitality.
But Decider, they’re trespassers.
Every hospitality.
Yes ma’am.
Decider, I’m going to have to insist that you release these Marshmen.
That’s not going to happen. We’ve come a long way and taken a lot of risks to get them.
You’ve no right to treat them this way!
Speaking of risks, if they wake up, are you sure this glass is strong enough to contain them?
(FX: THE DOCTOR GIVES THE GLASS TWO DEMONSTRATIVE STRIKES WITH THE SIDE OF HIS FIST.)
by Andrew Smith (FINAL) Page 33
(CONTINUED) .. Because you had better be very sure.
They won’t wake up.
How do you know?
Marshman hibernation is ended by a drop in temperature. Solus, what’s the water temperature at the moment?
Twenty four degrees.
More than adequate. We’ll keep them nice and warm until we’re ready for them to revive.
And then what? Vivisection?
(EMPHATICALLY) No.
Why take them at all?
Our mission is entirely ethical. Come next door and let me show you our Science Unit, where this work is co-ordinated.
Decider, if you’ll excuse me, I have to write up my patrol report.
Certainly.
Citizen Arana, stay with these ‘friends of Alzarius’, make sure they get anything they need.
Yes, Mr Solus.
